intro: Peucedanum decursivum var. albiflorum, commonly known as the whiteflower cowparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic and often used in traditional herbal medicine. Native to Europe, it thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and valuable species within its native habitat.
